author: By Joseph Curtis For Mailonline
title: Pictured together for the first time: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
description: The first pictures of Prince Harry and his American actress girlfriend Meghan Markle have emerged after the couple were snapped while on a romantic night out at the theatre in London.

author: By Stephen Matthews For Mailonline
title: Teenager experienced 'sympathy pains' in his knee
description: Pat and Al Dawson, both from Edinburgh, had knee pains in sync with each other. Tests found Al had osteosarcoma - a rare form of bone cancer that eventually took his life just two years later.

author: By James Dunn For Mailonline
title: Killer punched man to death while victim was on a dialysis machine
description: Adam Goodridge, 30, turned up at Paul Sandford's (pictured) home in Maltby, South Yorkshire, and made the accusation, which police called 'unfounded', then began the assault.

author: By Ben Spencer Medical Correspondent For The Daily Mail
title: Sugar levy is set to slash child obesity rates by 10%
description: Scientists at Oxford University have calculated there will be 144,000 fewer cases of obesity among adults and children alike if the levy on sugar-laden soft drinks achieves its goals.

author: By Joseph Curtis For Mailonline
title: Legal secretary, 41, killed pensioner neighbour with a rolling pin
description: Sandra Weir, 41, was found guilty of murdering her 'trusted friend' and neighbour Mary Logie, 82, after battering her with a rolling pin 31 times inside her home in Fife, Scotland.

author: Taylor Trudon
title: 12 Social Media Warriors Who Helped Restore Our Faith In 2016
description: Their tweets, YouTube videos, and ’grams helped make this year suck a little bit less

title: A farewell love letter to the City of London
description: ‘You are the creation of incomers as much as the English’

author: By Rebecca Taylor and Thomas Burrows
title: Pensioner given £5 worth £50,000 at cafe will give it to granddaughter
description: An elderly art fan, who wishes to remain anonymous, has found one of the rare Jane Austen £5 notes spent in a cafe in south Wales. She said she'll save it for her granddaughter.

title: Lady Problems Superlatives: The Winners And Losers Of 2016

title: Shocking new footage shows children working in North Korean mines
description: New images of children appearing to have been forced to work in coal mines in North Korea have been condemned by politicians and charities who described the scenes as 'absolutely appalling'.

title: Brexit talks could take a DECADE, UK's EU ambassador warned ministers
description: The European Commission's chief negotiator and former French minister Michel Barnier is believed to have told EU leaders of £50billion bill during his tour of EU capitals.
